meanings.definition: Existing at the same time as something else.
meanings.sent1: The coeternal stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were coeternal in their love for each other.
meanings.sent3: The coeternal friendship between the two dogs was evident in their playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The coeternal bond between the twins was unbreakable, like a chain forged in steel.
meanings.sent5: The coeternal connection between the artist and his muse inspired timeless masterpieces.

meanings.definition: Having the same age or duration.
meanings.sent1: The coeternal trees in the forest stood tall and proud.
meanings.sent2: The coeternal classmates celebrated their 50th reunion together.
meanings.sent3: The coeternal rivalry between the two teams always led to exciting matches.
meanings.sent4: The coeternal mountains seemed to touch the sky, their peaks reaching for eternity.
meanings.sent5: The coeternal partnership between the two companies lasted through decades of success.
